events.message: The customer reported their vehicle was involved in a collision with another car at the intersection downtown during rush hour.
Claim was categorised under Auto Accident based on keywords found in the initial incident report and description.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the case and to contact the customer for further details and documentation requests.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured the customer of support throughout.
The agent requested the customer to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and the other driver's insurance information.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including medical reports for minor injuries sustained during the accident.
Investigation team started examining the collision details, assessing the damage estimate and reviewing submitted materials.
Investigation concluded that the accident was mostly the other partyâ€™s fault, and damages were sufficiently documented.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the full repair costs and medical expense reimbursements.
The customer provided positive feedback appreciating the quick response and clarity of the settlement proposal.
The claim was officially approved based on investigation findings and agreement with the customer on settlement terms.
Payment covering vehicle repairs and medical treatments was issued to the customer promptly after claim approval.
The insurance claim was officially closed after customer confirmation of received payment and repaired vehicle status.
